name: Sky Blue DeVille (Vinyl)
description:
Adam Klein & The Wild Fires' first album together! Release April 16, 2013. Featuring special guests Randall Bramblett, Ike Stubblefield, David Blackmon, and more.

Pressed on randomly-mixed colored, 150-gram vinyl with lyrics/credits insert and mp3 download card.

"... an immensely accomplished record"- Flyin Shoes

“… nine songs of clean, winsome but lonely Americana and country soul… Sky Blue DeVille, at its most tender and honest, reflects the calm genius of Lyle Lovett’s Pontiac.”- Andre Gallant, Athens Banner-Herald

"... a wonderful album that completely reinforces the faith one has in a particular genre. Honesty, strength and musical heft."- Americana UK

name: Sky Blue DeVille (CD)
description:
Adam Klein & The Wild Fires' first album together! Release April 16, 2013. 
Featuring special guests Randall Bramblett, Ike Stubblefield, David Blackmon, and more.

name: Dugu Wolo (CD)
description:
Adam's first 'world music' record, recorded in Bamako, Mali, and featuring traditional West African instrumentation (kora, ngoni, calabash, talking drum, etc.). Original songs in the Bambara language. American roots meets rustic Mande music.

Beautiful digipak CD and booklet featuring an essay on Adam's musical experience in Mali, description of the instrumentation, pictures, and a  write-up on the meaning of the songs.

“A remarkably soulful record, leaving a warm glow in its wake… there is a sublime beauty to the interplay of instruments.. a rather beautiful piece of work.”- John Davy, Flyin Shoes

“A beautiful combination of blues, jazz, and acoustic folk with traditional Mandinka music… Dugu Wolo is a piece of music art. “- Altcountryforum

“Purity and tranquility radiate from this album… stunning.”- Rootstime

name: Wounded Electric Youth (CD)
description:
The latest release from Adam Klein! Acclaimed Americana folk-pop gem featuring AJ Adams, David Blackmon (fiddle), Randall Bramblett (saxophone and piano), Lera Lynn (harmony vocals), Carlton Owens, Jason Fuller and Jess Franklin (rhodes and organ), and other top Athens musicians.   

“Wounded Electric Youth is a bold move for Adam Klein… one of the finest albums of the year. This is a treasure trove of song writing."- Americana UK

“Short list for best album of the year.. a songwriter and interpreter in a state of grace and constant growth, a name to follow absolutely.”- Roots Highway

“One step further in his artistic evolution… Klein is a brilliant songwriter and storyteller…”- Rootstime

name: Western Tales & Trails (CD)
description:
Touches of rustic folk, Americana, Texas swing, Sun Studios’ rockabilly, and folk-rock delivered by an all-star cast of Athens, Georgia’s finest, including AJ Adams, Randall Bramblett, John Neff (Drive-By Truckers), Carlton Owens & more.

“Brilliant album”- Rootsville 

“Compelling stories from a gifted storyteller… Klein has found a rich vein of songwriting material and mined it with extraordinary skill… recalling Paul Simon but imbued with the wide eyed spirit of Neil Young.”-Americana UK

“[Klein’s] star is on the rise… Townes Van Zandt, Mark Olson, Steve Earle and Josh Ritter come to mind spontaneously upon listening to Klein’s soul-moving performance.”- CtrlAltCountry

name: Distant Music (CD)
description:
Debut record. A collection of rustic, dusty country folk songs colored with pedal steel, fiddle, dobro, and piano by some of Athens’ finest players, including David Barbe (wurlitzer), David Blackmon (fiddle), Drive-By Truckers' John Neff (pedal steel), & William Tonks of Bloodkin (dobro, guitar).

“… an engaging debut that’s as reliable and uncomplicated as a stout cup of coffee. It’s a fun, unpretentious batch of originals that suits this decade as well as any of the previous four.”- Flagpole Magazine

“Klein is exploring standard themes common to most songwriters. However, the fact that his songs are so obviously well-crafted, and the fact that his presentation— an engaging voice and quiet, acoustic country meets early-Dylanesque folk arrangements— ensures that Klein rises above the pack.”- Sing Out!

“… an album steeped in the cosmic cowboy music of the late 1960s to early 1970s. Think Neil Young’s loping country beat from Harvest and the harmonies of The Band. You can hear familiar echoes of musicians like Woody Guthrie, Guy Clark and Bob Dylan… As with Dylan during his domestic period (1968-74), Klein’s songs reflect a life being lived… one part Planet Waves and one part Travels with Charlie.”- Warren McQuiston, Southeast Performer Magazine

name: Cowboy Angel Music Coffee
description: A special dark roast Cowboy Angel Music blend coffee. Features a mix of beans from La Selva Negra coffee cooperative in the hills near Matagalpa, Nicaragua, and Monsooned Malabar beans from India's southern Malabar coast of Kerala and Karnataka. Support organic, free trade coffee with the CAM blend from Athens' Jittery Joe's.

name: Cowboy Angel Music T-shirt
description:
First Cowboy Angel Music t-shirt. Now available in Small, Medium, Large, and Extra Large.

Unisex, heath brown color.

Ships from Athens, GA.

name: Adam Klein & The Wild Fires T-shirt
description:
First Adam Klein & The Wild Fires band t-shirt. 100% cotton, organic. Now available in Extra Small, Small, Medium, Large, and Extra Large.

Women's Green and Unisex Heather Blue colors. 

Ships from Athens, GA.

name: Adam Klein T-shirts
description:
New fall 2011 'Bear' design T-shirts. 100% cotton, organic. Now available in Extra Small, Small, Medium, Large & Extra Large. 

Women's Baby Blue & Unisex Heather Grey. It's a looker!
 

Ships from Athens, GA.

name: Limited Edition Show Posters
description:
Special limited edition screen-printed show posters from Adam Klein shows, including "Distant Music CD Release" poster, as well as Melting Point & 40 Watt performances (shown here). Designed by Nick Canada of Athens' Satisfactory Printing! 

Please note: Each poster represents half of the full panel seen in the picture, announcing one of the two shows.
